de.mrapp.android.sidebar.animation

Class ContentViewScrollAnimation

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.animation.Animation
      • android.view.animation.AnimationSet
        • de.mrapp.android.sidebar.animation.ContentViewScrollAnimation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class ContentViewScrollAnimation
extends android.view.animation.AnimationSet
    An animation, which allows to move a sidebar's content view, when the sidebar should be shown or hidden.
    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class android.view.animation.Animation

    • Constructor Detail

      • ContentViewScrollAnimation

        public ContentViewScrollAnimation(ContentView contentView,
                                  long duration,
                                  float distance,
                                  float scrollRatio,
                                  float overlayTransparency,
                                  boolean show)
        Creates a new animation, which allows to move a sidebar's content view, when the sidebar should be shown or hidden.
        Parameters:
        contentView - The content view, which should be moved, as an instance of the class ContentView. The content view may not be null
        duration - The duration of the animation in milliseconds, as a Long value. The duration may not be less than 0
        distance - The distance, the sidebar view should be moved by, as a Float value. If the value is negative, the view will be moved to the left, if it is positive, the view will be moved to the right
        scrollRatio - The ratio between the distance, the sidebar view and the content view are moved by, as a Float value. The ratio may be at least 0 and at maximum 1. The distance is multiplied by the ratio to calculate the distance, the content view should be moved by
        overlayTransparency - The transparency of the overlay, which should be applied, when the sidebar is shown, as a Float value. If set to 0.0, the overlay will be completely transparent, if set to 1.0, the overlay will not be transparent at all
        show - True, if the sidebar should be shown at the end of the animation, false otherwise
